title: Available Maps
text: 50 US states
code: get_coordinates(map = "states50", coords = "hexmap") |>    ggplot() +    geom_sf(fill = "grey35", color = "white") +    geom_sf_text(aes(label = abbr_usps), color = "white") +    theme_void()

title: Available Maps
text: 50 US States District Columbia.
code: get_coordinates(map = "statesDC", coords = "hexmap") |>    ggplot() +    geom_sf(fill = "grey35", color = "white") +    geom_sf_text(aes(label = abbr_usps), color = "white") +    theme_void()

title: Available Maps
text: 50 US States, District Columbia, 5 territories: Puerto Rico, Virgin Islands, American Samoa, Northern Marina Islands.
code: get_coordinates(map = "statesTerr", coords = "hexmap") |>    ggplot() +    geom_sf(fill = "grey35", color = "white") +    geom_sf_text(aes(label = abbr_usps), color = "white") +    theme_void()

title: Available Maps
text: 50 US States, District Columbia (DC), 5 territories (Puerto Rico, Virgin Islands, American Samoa, Northern Marina Islands), freely associated state Palau. WIOA: Workforce Innovation Opportunity (workforce dev. legislation) ETA: Department Labor’s Employment Training Administration ETA regions rarely plotted , nice add border group states region together.
code: get_coordinates(map = "WIOAETA", coords = "hexmap") |>    ggplot() +    geom_sf(aes(fill = eta_region_name), color = "white") +    geom_sf(data = get_coordinates("WIOAETAregions", "hexmap"),            fill = NA, color = "grey35", linewidth = 1) +    geom_sf_text(aes(label = abbr_usps), color = "white") +    theme_void()

title: CSR for Map
text: ’s possible ‘square’ hex map changing coordinate reference system (CRS) WGS 84 / Pseudo-Mercator CRS (EPSG code 3857).
code: sf_other <- st_transform(sf_other, 3857) gg1 <- ggplot(sf_other) +    geom_sf() +   geom_sf_text(aes(label=abbr_usps)) +   labs(title = "Other hex map - hexagons look the same size when change CRS to 3857") +    theme_void()  gg2 <- ggplot(sf_usahex) +    geom_sf() +    geom_sf_text(aes(label=abbr_usps)) +   labs(title = "usahex map - all hexagons are the same size") +    theme_void()  plot_grid(gg1, gg2, nrow = 1)

title: CSR for Map
code: gg1 <- ggplot(sf_other) +    geom_sf() +   geom_sf_text(aes(label=paste0(abbr_usps, "\n", fips))) +   labs(title = "Other hex map - labels evenly spaced since single label with line break") +    theme_void()  gg2 <- ggplot(sf_usahex) +    geom_sf() +    geom_sf_text(aes(label=paste0(abbr_usps, "\n", fips))) +   labs(title = "usahex map - labels evenly spaced since single label with line break") +    theme_void()  plot_grid(gg1, gg2, nrow = 1)

title: CSR for Map
code: gg1 <-ggplot(sf_other) +    geom_sf() +   geom_sf_text(     data = mutate(sf_other, geometry = geometry + c(0, 100000)) |> sf::st_set_crs(3857),       aes(label=abbr_usps),      fontface = "bold",      size = 3.25   ) +   geom_sf_text(     data = mutate(sf_other, geometry = geometry + c(0, -100000)) |> sf::st_set_crs(3857),       aes(label=fips),      size = 2.25   ) +   labs(title = "Other hex map - labels evenly spaced since single label with line break") +    theme_void()  gg2 <- ggplot(sf_usahex) +    geom_sf() +      geom_sf_text(     data = mutate(sf_usahex, geometry = geometry + c(0, 5)),       aes(label=abbr_usps),      fontface = "bold",      size = 3.25   ) +   geom_sf_text(     data = mutate(sf_usahex, geometry = geometry + c(0, -5)),       aes(label=fips),      size = 2.25   ) +   labs(title = "usahex map - labels evenly spaced since single label with line break") +    theme_void()  plot_grid(gg1, gg2, nrow = 1)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Martha Eichlersmith. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Eichlersmith M (2025). usahex: Hex Maps US States Territories. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://mareichler.github.io/usahex/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {usahex: Hex Maps of US States and Territories},   author = {Martha Eichlersmith},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://mareichler.github.io/usahex/}, }

title: Hex Maps of US States and Territories
Hex Maps of US States and Territories
text: ’ve copied coordinates NPR Graphics team: github.com/nprapps/dailygraphics-templates. y values reversed plot upside .
code: library(usahex) library(tidyverse) get_coordinates(map = "WIOAETA", coords = "hexmap") |>    ggplot() +    geom_sf(aes(fill = geo_type)) +    geom_sf_text(aes(label = abbr_usps)) +    theme_void()

title: WIOAETA shapefile data — WIOAETA
text: Hexagon map shape file includes: 50 States 1 federal district: District Columbia 5 territories: Puerto Rico, Virgin Islands, American Samoa, Northern Mariana Islands 1 freely associated state: Palau

title: WIOAETA shapefile data — WIOAETA
text: Simple feature collection abbr_usps 2-letter code used United States Postal Service abbr_gpo abbreviations US Government Printing Office abbr_ap abbreviations AP Stylebook name Name geographic area fips 2-digit FIPS code (Federal Information Processing Standard) geo_type Type region: state, federal district, territory, freely associated state geometry polygon coordinates hexagon

title: WIOAETA shapefile data — WIOAETA
text: Coordinates hex map based NPR's daily graphic template, https://github.com/nprapps/dailygraphics-templates/blob/master/state_grid_map/index.html Abbreviations pulled List U.S. state territory abbreviations, https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_U.S._state_and_territory_abbreviations Department Labor, Employment Training Administration https://www.dol.gov/agencies/eta Workforce Innovation Opportunity Act https://www.dol.gov/agencies/eta/wioa/ ETA regions https://www.dol.gov/agencies/eta/regions

title: WIOAETA shapefile data — WIOAETA
text: based ETA (Department Labor's Employment Training Administration) regions reporting WIOA (Workforce Innovation Opportunity Act) performance.

title: WIOAETA_labels shapefile data — WIOAETA_labels
text: Point coordinates center hexagon includes: 50 States 1 federal district: District Columbia 5 territories: Puerto Rico, Virgin Islands, American Samoa, Northern Mariana Islands 1 freely associated state: Palau

title: WIOAETAregions shapefile data — WIOAETAregions
text: Multi-polygon shape file 6 ETA regions.

title: WIOAETAregions shapefile data — WIOAETAregions
text: Simple feature collection eta_region Number code representing ETA region, 1-6 eta_region_name Name region etaA_region_city City headquarters ETA region geometry Multi-polygon coordinates region borders hexagon map

title: WIOAETAregions shapefile data — WIOAETAregions

text: based ETA (Department Labor's Employment Training Administration) regions reporting WIOA (Workforce Innovation Opportunity Act) performance.

title: Import hex map coordinates — get_coordinates
text: Import hex map coordinates

title: Import hex map coordinates — get_coordinates
text: map character string specifying map. Current options "states50" (50 US States ), "statesDC" (50 states DC), "statesTerr" (50 states, DC, Puerto Rico, Virgin Islands, Guam, American Samoa, Marshall Islands), "WIOAETA" (WIOA ETA geographies, statesTerr addition Palau), "WIOAETARegions" (unified maps WIOA ETA regions) . coords character string specifying "hexmap" hexagon coordinates "labels" label coordinates hex map

title: Import hex map coordinates — get_coordinates
text: sf object map, either hexagons (polygon) labels (point).

title: Import hex map coordinates — get_coordinates
code: get_coordinates(map = "states50", coords = "hexmap") #> Simple feature collection with 50 features and 6 fields #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 0.8845727 ymin: -250 xmax: 433.8973 ymax: 0 #> CRS:           NA #> First 10 features: #>    abbr_usps abbr_gpo abbr_ap        name fips geo_type #> 1         AK   Alaska  Alaska      Alaska   02    state #> 2         AL     Ala.    Ala.     Alabama   01    state #> 3         AR     Ark.    Ark.    Arkansas   05    state #> 4         AZ    Ariz.   Ariz.     Arizona   04    state #> 5         CA   Calif.  Calif.  California   06    state #> 6         CO    Colo.   Colo.    Colorado   08    state #> 7         CT    Conn.   Conn. Connecticut   09    state #> 8         DE     Del.    Del.    Delaware   10    state #> 9         FL     Fla.    Fla.     Florida   12    state #> 10        GA      Ga.     Ga.     Georgia   13    state #>                          geometry #> 1  POLYGON ((35.52559 0, 52.84... #> 2  POLYGON ((278.0127 -180, 29... #> 3  POLYGON ((226.0512 -150, 24... #> 4  POLYGON ((139.4486 -180, 15... #> 5  POLYGON ((87.48711 -150, 10... #> 6  POLYGON ((139.4486 -120, 15... #> 7  POLYGON ((399.2563 -90, 416... #> 8  POLYGON ((381.9357 -120, 39... #> 9  POLYGON ((295.3332 -210, 31... #> 10 POLYGON ((312.6537 -180, 32... get_coordinates(map = "states50", coords = "labels") #> Simple feature collection with 50 features and 6 fields #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 18.20508 ymin: -230 xmax: 416.5768 ymax: -20 #> CRS:           NA #> First 10 features: #>    abbr_usps abbr_gpo abbr_ap        name fips geo_type              geometry #> 1         AK   Alaska  Alaska      Alaska   02    state  POINT (35.52559 -20) #> 2         AL     Ala.    Ala.     Alabama   01    state POINT (278.0127 -200) #> 3         AR     Ark.    Ark.    Arkansas   05    state POINT (226.0512 -170) #> 4         AZ    Ariz.   Ariz.     Arizona   04    state POINT (139.4486 -200) #> 5         CA   Calif.  Calif.  California   06    state POINT (87.48711 -170) #> 6         CO    Colo.   Colo.    Colorado   08    state POINT (139.4486 -140) #> 7         CT    Conn.   Conn. Connecticut   09    state POINT (399.2563 -110) #> 8         DE     Del.    Del.    Delaware   10    state POINT (381.9358 -140) #> 9         FL     Fla.    Fla.     Florida   12    state POINT (295.3332 -230) #> 10        GA      Ga.     Ga.     Georgia   13    state POINT (312.6537 -200)

title: states50 shapefile data — states50
text: Hexagon map shape file includes: 50 States

title: states50 shapefile data — states50
text: Simple feature collection abbr_usps 2-letter code used United States Postal Service abbr_gpo abbreviations US Government Printing Office abbr_ap abbreviations AP Stylebook name Name geographic area fips 2-digit FIPS code (Federal Information Processing Standard) geo_type Type region: state, federal district, territory, freely associated state geometry polygon coordinates hexagon
